title: 39 Ways to Save the Planet: #4 Educating and Empowering Girls

multipleselect.text: What are some of the reasons why girls do not attend school in sub-Saharan Africa?
answers: poverty; when there is money boys are seen as a better investment
fear for girls' safety, particulary when schools are far
alternatives: parents not wanting girls to receive an education

multipleselect.text: According to Fiona Mavinga how do women benefit from an education?
answers: have a greater choice over when they marry

multipleselect.text: In the project described, insects are cited as a good source of protein because:

they produce far lower GHGs in comparison to other animal sources of protein

cards.term: What are is the value of investing in girls' education?
cards.definition: Girls’ education is the starting point for securing the rights of women and girls globally, while improving community health and resilience to climate shocks. It also leads to a drastic decrease in emissions. It's the most profound investment we can make to secure our planet’s future.
